title: Credits
description: Credits for the @ibnlanre/builder package.

---

# Credits

A lot of people have contributed to the development of the `@ibnlanre/builder` package, through their feedback, suggestions, and contributions. We are grateful to everyone who has helped to make this package what it is today. We appreciate all the support we have received, and we are committed to making the `@ibnlanre/builder` package even better.

<blockquote className="nx-text-2xl nx-italic nx-leading-tight nx-mt-8 nx-border-gray-300 nx-text-justify nx-text-gray-700 dark:nx-border-gray-700 dark:nx-text-gray-400 ltr:nx-border-l-2 ltr:nx-pl-6 rtl:nx-border-r-2 rtl:nx-pr-6">Thanks!<br />Inspired by this post, I wr<del className="nx-underline">o</del>te a utility method to build keys from config with good type hints <span className="nx-not-italic">ðŸ˜€</span><br /><small className="nx-not-italic nx-mt-3 nx-inline-block">â€” [Alvin Huang](https://linkedin.com/in/hemense-lan)</small></blockquote>

The concept of a "Key Generation" mechanism was conceived independently, drawing inspiration from [TanStack Query][tanstack]. Its development was further propelled after reading the blog post, [Effective React Query Keys][react-query] by [TKDodo][twitter]. The initial functional model of this idea was discovered in a comment by [Alvin Huang][github] in a [TypeScript playground][playground] associated with the same article. Recognizing its alignment with the goal of simplifying key management, the model was refined and developed into the `@ibnlanre/builder` package.

<blockquote className="nx-text-2xl nx-italic nx-leading-tight nx-mt-8 nx-border-gray-300 nx-text-justify nx-text-gray-700 dark:nx-border-gray-700 dark:nx-text-gray-400 ltr:nx-border-l-2 ltr:nx-pl-6 rtl:nx-border-r-2 rtl:nx-pr-6">We are grateful to Alvin for sharing his idea, which has since been adopted and expanded upon.<br /><small className="nx-not-italic nx-mt-3 nx-inline-block">â€” [Ridwan Olanrewaju][linkedin]</small></blockquote>

The `@ibnlanre/builder` library leverages the [builder pattern][wikipedia] to dynamically generate keys from complex data structures. This design principle separates the creation of intricate keys from their application, making the library particularly useful when keys need to be represented in various forms. The `@ibnlanre/builder` package is an effective adaptation of this pattern, specifically tailored to make key generation and retrieval, more efficient, and user-friendly.

[react-query]: https://tkdodo.eu/blog/effective-react-query-keys
[twitter]: https://twitter.com/tkdodo
[github]: https://github.com/huanguolin
[linkedin]: https://www.linkedin.com/in/ibnlanre
[wikipedia]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Builder_pattern
[tanstack]: https://tanstack.com/query

[playground]: https://www.typescriptlang.org/play?#code/C4TwDgpgBAwghgZ2AHgBoBooE0B8UC8UqUEAHsBAHYAmC2UA--QXINLDQgDrWuXcD2PFlRnw2l+RAIEQXBGFRChCEoFieIkkoA4tGxCQ80EXN1HxCQQK2MRoQQdRNTI34KMFdiuMoHj0HE1x0jIiVSgQaA4NEMDfCQRRsggZ9X3fYA8NpVxCNfEioDtSSnWk--FurNOjv0O726sYPthB+ikei53AA2Tes+3ungAZkoj8LoAA
